page.title: 13The village schools.
page.content: Both Melling and Arkholme have their own C.E.Primary school. They are both old schools. Melling has had extra classrooms and a kitchen built within the last 20 years. Numbers of children in Melling have dropped in recent years from 70+ to 30 with 2 teachers<19 boys- 11 girls>. Arkholme has 3 teachers for 58 pupils in small rooms. Dinners are provided in both schools by their own cooks. A mini- bus brings children to Melling from 4 other villages and hill farms. Both schools have weekly swim- ming lessons at Hornby baths and an evening club. Parents come in to help with the craft,music, computer,and gardening. We take part in competitive sports with other small schools in the the Lune valley. For mutual help the staff of these schools meet regularly and are setting up a pool of resources which the schools can all share.
